workflow.name: Sync Zendesk how-to tickets to Google Sheets knowledge base
workflow.description:
## Description:
Keep your customer knowledge base up to date with this n8n automation template. The workflow connects Zendesk with Google Sheets, automatically fetching tickets tagged as ‚Äúhowto,‚Äù enriching them with requester details, and saving them into a structured spreadsheet.

 This ensures your internal or public knowledge base reflects the latest customer how-to queries‚Äîwithout manual copy-pasting. Perfect for customer support teams, SaaS companies, and service providers who want to streamline documentation workflows.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
 ‚ö° Manual Trigger or Scheduling
-  Run the workflow manually for testing/troubleshooting, or configure a schedule trigger for daily/weekly updates.
üì• Fetch All Zendesk Tickets
-  Connects to your Zendesk account and retrieves all available tickets.
üîç Filter for "howto" Tickets Only
-  Processes only tickets that contain the ‚Äúhowto‚Äù tag, ensuring relevance.
üë§ Enrich User Data
-  Fetches requester details (name, email, profile info) to provide context.
üìä Update Google Sheets Knowledge Base
-  Saves ticket data‚Äîincluding Ticket No., Description, Status, Tag, Owner Name, and Email.
 ‚úîÔ∏è Smart update prevents duplicates by matching on description.
üîÅ Continuous Sync
-  Each new or updated ‚Äúhowto‚Äù ticket is synced automatically into your knowledge base sheet.

## Key Features
 üîç Tag-based filtering for precise categorization
 üìä Smart append-or-update logic in Google Sheets
 ‚ö° Zendesk + Google Sheets integration with OAuth2
 ‚ôªÔ∏è Keeps knowledge base fresh without manual effort
 üîê Secure API credential handling

## Use Cases
 üìñ Maintain a live ‚Äúhow-to‚Äù guide from real customer queries
 üéì Build self-service documentation for support teams
 üì© Monitor and track recurring help topics
 üíº Equip knowledge managers with a ready-to-export dataset

## Required Integrations
- Zendesk API (for ticket fetch + user info)
- Google Sheets (for storing/updating records)

## Why Use This Template?
 ‚úÖ Automates repetitive data entry
 ‚úÖ Ensures knowledge base accuracy & freshness
 ‚úÖ Reduces support team workload
 ‚úÖ Easy to extend with more tags, filters, or sheet logic

parameters.content:
## Error Trigger Node

Automatically activates when ANY node in the workflow fails.

**How it works:**
- Monitors the entire workflow execution
- Catches errors from any node
- Triggers the error handling path
- Prevents silent failures

**Best Practice:** This ensures no errors go unnoticed in production.

## Format Error Details

Transforms raw error data into structured, readable format.

**Extracted Information:**
- Timestamp of error
- Workflow and execution IDs
- Failed node name
- Error message and type
- Context (which ticket/item failed)
- Stack trace for debugging
- Severity level

**Output:** Clean JSON ready for logging to sheets.

## Error Log Sheet

Persists all error details to Google Sheets for tracking and analysis.

**Log Columns:**
- Timestamp
- Workflow Name
- Execution ID
- Node Name
- Error Message
- Error Type
- Ticket/Item ID
- Stack Trace
- Status
- Severity

**Benefits:** Historical error tracking, pattern identification, audit trail.

## Email Error Notification

Sends immediate alert emails when workflow fails.

**Email Contains:**
- Error summary
- Failed node name
- Timestamp
- Link to execution (if configured)

**Configuration Required:**
- Set up SMTP credentials
- Update 'fromEmail' and 'toEmail'
- Can add multiple recipients

**Tip:** Consider using Slack/Teams webhooks instead for faster alerts.

## Success Summary

Calculates and formats execution success metrics.

**What it does:**
- Counts total tickets processed
- Captures execution timestamp
- Records workflow and execution IDs
- Creates success message

**Purpose:** Provides visibility into successful runs, not just failures. Helps track workflow performance over time.

## Execution Log Sheet

Logs ALL successful workflow executions.

**Logged Data:**
- Timestamp
- Workflow Name
- Execution ID
- Status (SUCCESS)
- Number of tickets processed
- Success message

**Use Cases:**
- Monitor workflow health
- Track processing volume
- Performance trending
- Audit compliance

**Combined with Error Log:** Complete execution history.

## Workflow Purpose

This workflow automatically updates a Google Sheets knowledge base with Zendesk tickets that have the "howto" tag.

**Flow Overview:**
1. Fetches all tickets from Zendesk
2. Filters for tickets with "howto" tag only
3. Gets detailed user information for each ticket
4. Updates Google Sheets with ticket details
5. **NEW: Comprehensive error handling and logging**

**Use Case:** Perfect for maintaining a knowledge base of how-to requests from customers.

## Manual Trigger

Click the 'Execute Workflow' button to run this automation manually.

**When to use:**
- Testing the workflow
- One-time data sync
- Troubleshooting

**Note:** You can also set this up with a schedule trigger to run automatically (daily, weekly, etc.)

## Zendesk Integration

Fetches ALL tickets from your Zendesk instance.

**What it does:**
- Connects to Zendesk using API credentials
- Retrieves all available tickets
- Passes ticket data to next step

**Important:** Make sure your Zendesk credentials are properly configured in the node settings.

## Filtering Logic

Only processes tickets with the "howto" tag.

**Filter Condition:**
- Checks if first tag equals "howto"
- Case sensitive matching
- Only matching tickets proceed to next step

**Tip:** You can modify this filter to use different tags or multiple conditions as needed.

## User Details Enrichment

Gets detailed information about the person who created each ticket.

**Retrieved Data:**
- User name
- Email address
- Other user profile information

**Why needed:** The initial ticket data only contains user ID, but we need name and email for the spreadsheet.

## Google Sheets Update

Saves or updates ticket information in your knowledge base spreadsheet.

**Data Saved:**
- Ticket Number
- Description
- Status
- Tag
- Owner Name
- Email

**Smart Update:** Uses description as matching column to avoid duplicates - existing tickets get updated instead of creating new rows.

## üö® Error Handling & Logging

**Production Features Added:**

1. **Error Trigger:** Catches all workflow errors automatically

2. **Error Logger:** Logs detailed error info to Google Sheets:
   - Timestamp
   - Error node name
   - Error message
   - Failed ticket/user ID
   - Stack trace

3. **Retry Logic:** Auto-retries failed operations

4. **Email Notifications:** Alerts team on failures

**Monitor errors in the Error Log sheet!**

nodes.name: Log Error to Sheet1
nodes.notes: Creates Error Log sheet if it doesn't exist

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
